gurmukhi: ਦੲੇ ਕੋਟ ਦਾਨੰ ਪਕੇ ਪਰਮ ਪਾਕੰ ||
transliteration: Dae Kot Daanan Pake Param Paakan||
translation: Millins of gifts were given in charity and pure foods were served.

gurmukhi: ਕਲੂ ਮੱਧਿ ਕੀਨੋ ਬਡੋ ਧਰਮ ਸਾਕੰ ||
transliteration: Kaloo Maddh(i) Keeno Bado Dharam Saakan||
translation: The king performed a great event of Dharma in the Kaliyuga.

gurmukhi: ਲਗੀ ਦੇਖਨੇ ਅਾਪ ਜਿੳੁਂ ਰਾਜ ਬਾਲਾ ||
translation: As the queen began to scan all this,
She the most beautiful and abode of Supreme glory.32.200.

gurmukhi: ੳੁਡਯੋ ਪੳੁਨ ਕੇ ਬੇਗ ਸਿਓ ਅਗ੍ਰ ਪੱਤ੍ਰੰ ||
transliteration: Udyo Paoun Ke Beg Sio Agra Pattran||
translation: The frontal garment of the queen flew away by the gust of wind.

gurmukhi: ਹਸੇ ਦੇਖ ਨਗਨੰ ਤ੍ਰੀਯੰ ਬਿਪ੍ਰ ਛੱਤ੍ਰੰ ||
transliteration: Hase Dekh Nagnan Treeyan Bipra Chhattran||
translation: The Brahmins and Kshatriyas (in the assembly) seeing the nakedness of the queen laughed.

gurmukhi: ਭੲਿਓ ਕੋਪ ਰਾਜਾ ਗਹੇ ਬਿਪ੍ਰ ਸਰਬੰ ||
transliteration: Bhaio Kop Raajaa Gade Bipra Saraban||
translation: The king in great fury caught hold of all the Brahmins.

gurmukhi: ਦਹੇ ਖੀਰ ਖੰਡੰ ਬਡੇ ਪਰਮ ਗਰਬੰ ||੩੩||੨੦੧||
transliteration: Dahe Kheer Khanndan Bade Param Gadaban||33||201||
translation: All the highly proud great Pundits were burnt with hot mixture of milk and sugar.33.201.

gurmukhi: ਪ੍ਰਿਥਮ ਬਾਂਧਿ ਕੈ ਸਰਬ ਮੂੰਡੇ ਮੁੰਡਾੲੇ ||
transliteration: Pritham Baandh(i) Kai Sarab Moondde Mounndaae||
translation: Firstly all the Brahmins were bound down and their heads were shaved.

gurmukhi: ਪੁਨਰ ੲੇਡੂਅਾ ਸੀਸ ਤਾਂ ਕੇ ਟਿਕਾੲੇ ||
transliteration: Pounar Edooaa Sees Taan Ke Tikaae||
translation: Then the pads were placed on the top of their heads.

gurmukhi: ਪੁਨਰ ਤਪਤ ਕੈ ਖੀਰ ਕੇ ਮੱਧਿ ਡਾਰਿਓ ||
transliteration: Pounar Tapat Kai Kheer Ke Maddh(i) Daario||
translation: Then the boiling milk was poured (within the pads).

gurmukhi: ੲਿਮੰ ਸਰਬ ਬਿਪ੍ਰਾਨ ਕੳੁ ਜਾਰਿ ਮਾਰਿਓ ||੩੪||੨੦੨||
transliteration: Iman Sarab Bipraan Kau Daar(i) Maario||34||202||
translation: And thus all the Brahmins were burnt and killed.34.202.

gurmukhi: ਕਿਤੇ ਬਾਂਧਿ ਕੈ ਬਿਪ੍ਰ ਬਾਚੇ ਦਿਵਾਰੰ ||
transliteration: Kite Baandh(i) Kai Bipra Baache Divaaran||
translation: Many Brahmins were entombed in the walls;

gurmukhi: ਕਿਤੇ ਬਾਂਧ ਫਾਂਸੀ ਦੀੲੇ ਬਿਪ੍ਰ ਭਾਰੰ ||
